meanings.sent1: She tricked her friend into thinking it was her birthday today.
meanings.sent2: He tricked his brother into believing that the sky is purple.
meanings.sent3: The magician tricked the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The clever fox tricked the rabbit into coming out of its burrow.
meanings.sent5: The con artist tricked the old lady into giving him all her savings.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to believe something that is not true
meanings.sent1: The prankster tricked his classmates into thinking it was a snow day.
meanings.sent2: She tricked her little brother into believing that cats can fly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy tricked his sister into wearing mismatched shoes to school.
meanings.sent4: The sly salesman tricked the customer into buying a faulty product.
meanings.sent5: The fake news article tricked many people into panic-buying supplies.

meanings.definition: To outwit or deceive someone by cunning or skillful means
meanings.sent1: The detective tricked the criminal into confessing to the crime.
meanings.sent2: The clever student tricked his teacher into giving extra credit for his homework.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon tricked the campers into leaving their food unattended.
meanings.sent4: The spy tricked the enemy into revealing their secret plans.
meanings.sent5: The escape artist tricked the guards and successfully broke out of prison.
